title: Mary Wilson of the Supremes: 'I'm not friends with Diana Ross'
text:
As a founder of the Supremes, Mary Wilson enjoyed glitz and glamour before their ‘lustre faded’, she tells Craig McLean

With make-up applied, wig in place and hip-shaking figure cosseted inside a soul-queen frock, it’s difficult to believe Mary Wilson is a 75-year-old grandmother.

The singer, standing in a television studio in west London, is about to go live on Good Morning America, where she will be unveiled as a contestant on Dancing with the Stars (the US version of Strictly Come Dancing).

“My daughter Turkessa, my son Pedrico and my 11 grandchildren are so thrilled that I’m in Dancing with the Stars,” she tells the perma-tanned hosts. “Finally, Grandma is cool!”

Laughter from the studio...
description: As a founder of the Supremes, Mary Wilson enjoyed glitz and glamour before their ‘lustre faded’, she tells Craig McLean
